revised_title: Microscopic Analysis of Andesite Rocks from Ecuadorian Mountains
tldr: The author examines the microscopic structure of various rocks from the Andes of Ecuador, collected by E. Whymper. They describe the characteristics and composition of rocks from mountains such as Altar, Illiniza, Sincholagua, Cotocachi, and Sara-urcu. The study focuses on the andesite group of rocks, which are common volcanic rocks, and provides insights into the geological and volcanic history of the region.
